channel.description:
The helicopter battle just felt really rough and difficult.
The RPG guidance was slow The Helicopter seemed to have unlimited rockets The [url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/8nsis1g0gi3lof6/2015-05-07_00060.jpg?dl=0]Rocks provided[/url] for cover [url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/zvjnpznfrgycy5w/2015-05-07_00061.jpg?dl=0]looked rushed[/url]

item.title: Surface Tension/Helicopter Battle
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
After lobbing what seemed like dozens of rockets into the helicopter, I found it easier to just stuff a few overcharged Tau bolts into the helicopter than to use the rockets, to be honest. The Tau bolts never miss, don’t require you to peek out of cover for more than about a second, and they’re much stronger than the rockets. The only real downside is the ammo isn’t infinite.

This is kind of problematic, IMO.

I made a thread about that (as the meshes also caught my crossbow arrows in spite of free sight on the enemies).

because after I found out I aimed at invisble meshes the heli was quite easy when I avoided the meshes.

item.title: Surface Tension/Helicopter Battle
item.dc:creator: Maki
item.description:
I felt I won this battle by gaming the system rather than through skill. After dying a couple times, I took cover by the rocks on the left (as you exit the garage area and come to the mouth of the cave) next to the RPG crate. The Helicopter couldn’t hit me while crouching and made no attempt to swing around to get line-of-sight on me, but I could hit it when I stood up.

Even though it’s true to the original, this felt like a real trial-by-fire. You aren’t given any chance to familiarize (or re-familiarize) yourself with the RPG and its toggleable seeking (coming from HL2, I didn’t know there was a toggle, and I couldn’t tell when it was on or off in this open area) before you’re thrown into a big boss battle.
